Class Vertex

  • Object
    • Vertex

  • class Vertex
extends Object
    Each of a StickPuppet's joints is represented by a vertex in a tree. The tree structure means that each vertex has a parent and children. The parent will be null for the root vertex. The children will be empty for a leaf vertex.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      ArrayList<Vertex> children
      Any child vertices.
      float heading
      The direction of our parent vertex from this vertex.
      int index
      An integer which is unique to this vertex.
      float magnitude
      The distance from this vertex to our parent vertex.
      Vertex parent
      Our parent vertex.
      static float pointSize
      How big the points you drag around with your mouse to manipulate the StickPuppet are (sometimes called lugs, handles or pivots).

    • Field Detail

      • index

        int index
        An integer which is unique to this vertex. Typically an index in an ArrayList>Vertex<
        See Also:
        StickPuppet.vertices

      • parent

        Vertex parent
        Our parent vertex. The parent will be null if we are the root vertex.

      • children

        ArrayList<Vertex> children
        Any child vertices. Will be empty if we are a leaf vertex.

      • magnitude

        float magnitude
        The distance from this vertex to our parent vertex.

      • heading

        float heading
        The direction of our parent vertex from this vertex.

      • pointSize

        static final float pointSize
        How big the points you drag around with your mouse to manipulate the StickPuppet are (sometimes called lugs, handles or pivots).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Vertex

        Vertex(int _index)
        Parameters:
        _index - The unique index of the vertex we are creating.

    • Method Detail

      • addChild

        public void addChild(Vertex child)
        Adds a child vertex to this vertex
        Parameters:
        child - The child vertex we are adding

      • getVector

        public PVector getVector(PVector pvParent)
        Calculate's the position of this vertex from the position of its parent vertex.
        Parameters:
        pvParent - PVector representing the position of our parent
        Returns:
        Our position

      • draw

        public void draw(PVector pvParent)
        Draw a line to our parent vertex, then recursively call our children so that all lines between vertices are drawn.
        Parameters:
        pvParent - PVector representing the position of our parent

      • drawPoints

        public void drawPoints(PVector pvParent)
        Draw a point at our present location (to show we can be dragged around with the mouse to manipulate the StickPuppet). Then recursively calls our children so that all points are drawn.
        Parameters:
        pvParent - PVector representing the position of our parent

      • rotate

        public void rotate(float angle)
        Rotate this vertex around its parent. Then call our children recursively so that they rotate with us (thus staying in the same position with respect to us).
        Parameters:
        angle - The amount to rotate by

      • tween

        public void tween(float value,
                  float start,
                  float stop,
                  Vertex parentA,
                  Vertex parentB)
        Calculate the direction of our parent vertex as somewhere in between the directions of the two given vertices. Then call our children recursively so they get tweened too. The parameters are based on Processing's map() function - in fact the only difference should be that we are not mapping to floats we are mapping to vertices.
        Parameters:
        value - The incoming value to be converted
        start - The lower bound of the value's current range
        stop - The upper bound of the value's current range
        parentA - The desired vertex's lower bound
        parentB - The desired vertex's upper bound

      • hitTest

        public int hitTest(PVector pvParent)
        Called to determine which vertex, if any, the mouse is currently over. If the mouse is not over this particular vertex, then our children are called recursively so they get hit tested too.
        Parameters:
        pvParent - The position of our parent vertex
        Returns:
        The index of the vertex the mouse is over, or -1 if the mouse is not currently over any vertex

      • mouseDragged

        public void mouseDragged(int currentDrag,
                         PVector pvParent)
        If this vertex is being dragged by the mouse then rotate appropriately in order to follow the mouse, otherwise call our children recursively in case one of them is being dragged.
        Parameters:
        currentDrag - The index of the vertex which is currently being dragged
        pvParent - The position of our parent vertex

      • getChildVector

        public PVector getChildVector(int desiredIndex,
                              PVector pvParent)
        Called to determine a particular vertex's x-y location. If this isn't the desired vertex then our children are called recursively so it can be located.
        Parameters:
        desiredIndex - The index of the vertex who's location we wish to determine
        pvParent - The position of our parent vertex
        Returns:
        The x-y location of the desired vertex, or null if that vertex cannot be located on this branch of the tree.
